wiki.summary: "Birds of a Feather" is a song by American singer-songwriter Billie Eilish from her third studio album, Hit Me Hard and Soft. It was released as the album's second single on July 2, 2024, by Darkroom and Interscope Records. The song was written by Eilish and her brother Finneas O'Connell, who also recorded and produced it in his home studio in Los Angeles. Characterized by elements of new wave and pop, the lyrics of "Birds of a Feather" address themes of intense emotional attachment and a desire for enduring connection. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "Birds of a Feather" is a song by American singer-songwriter Billie Eilish from her third studio album, Hit Me Hard and Soft. It was released as the album's second single on July 2, 2024, by Darkroom and Interscope Records. The song was written by Eilish and her brother Finneas O'Connell, who also recorded and produced it in his home studio in Los Angeles. Characterized by elements of new wave and pop, the lyrics of "Birds of a Feather" address themes of intense emotional attachment and a desire for enduring connection. The song reached number one on the Billboard Global 200 and topped the national charts in Australia, Croatia, Estonia, Iceland, Lithuania, Malaysia, New Zealand, and Singapore. It also peaked at number two in nine other countries. "Birds of a Feather" received Diamond certification in France and multi-platinum status in Australia, Canada, Greece, New Zealand, Poland, Portugal, the United Kingdom, and the United States. The song was nominated for Song of the Year, Record of the Year, and Best Pop Solo Performance at the 67th Annual Grammy Awards in 2025. Read more on Last.fm.
